message.content: We refer to the prescribing information for venlafaxine for help. Hypertension is listed as a potential side effect of this medication. Seizures, weight gain, and increased urination are not common side effects of venlafaxine.

We refer to the medication page for Venlafaxine on drugs.com. Hypertension is listed as a potential side effect of Venlafaxine. Seizures are a rare side effect, while weight gain and increased urination are not commonly associated with this medication.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Venlafaxine is an antidepressant that can also be used to treat anxiety disorders. One of its potential side effects is hypertension. Seizures and increased urination are not commonly associated with this medication, and weight gain is actually a less common side effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Venlafaxine can cause an increase in blood pressure, making hypertension a potential side effect. Seizures, weight gain, and increased urination are not common side effects of this medication.

We refer to the drug reference website Drugs.com for help. Among the potential side effects listed for venlafaxine, hypertension is a common side effect. Seizures, weight gain, and increased urination are not among the listed side effects.

We refer to the National Institutes of Health website for help. Venlafaxine is known to increase blood pressure, making hypertension a potential side effect. Seizures and increased urination are not common side effects, while weight gain can be a side effect but is less frequent than hypertension.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Venlafaxine may cause an increase in blood pressure as a potential side effect. Seizures, weight gain, and increased urination are not listed as common side effects of venlafaxine.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Venlafaxine is known to increase blood pressure, so hypertension is a potential side effect. Seizures, weight gain, and increased urination are not common side effects of this medication.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, hypertension is a potential side effect of venlafaxine. Seizures are a rare side effect, weight gain is not a common side effect, and increased urination is not listed as a side effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Venlafaxine is an antidepressant and anxiolytic medication that can increase blood pressure and cause hypertension as a potential side effect. Seizures, weight gain, and increased urination are not commonly reported as side effects of venlafaxine.
